Header: Space Station astronauts perform repairs on air leak
Content: Astronauts aboard the International Space Station conducted repair work one of two Russian Soyuz spacecraft attached to the orbiting outpost after a leak caused a dip in station pressure. Crew members of Expedition 56 reported a hole about two millimeters in diameter in the upper section of the Soyuz MS-09 spacecraft that is attached to a module of the Russian segment of the station. According to NASA the crew was never in danger and will return to their regular schedule. Roscosmos, the Russian space agency, will conduct an investigation into possible causes of the leak.
